question: A block of certain mass is placed on a rough inclined plane. The angle between the plane and the horizontal is $30^{\circ}$. The coefficients of static and kinetic frictions between the block and the inclined plane are 0.6 and 0.5 respectively. Then the magnitude of the acceleration of the block is [Take $g=10~ms^{-2}$]
explanation: Component of gravity down the slope $g \sin 30 = 0.5g$.
Since driving force (0.5g) < limiting friction (0.52g), the block does not move. Acceleration is zero.
